oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Military board marching in 1942 Army Day Parade
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Army Day Parade in front of the Tennessee State Capitol. This event featured the 2nd Tennessee Infantry on parade in downtown Nashville. Many people are lining the street watching the marchers as they walk by. A military band is marching. The Tennessee State Office Building in visible in the back, behind the marchers.

The parade marshal for the Army Day Parade was Col. H. H. Corson of the Tennessee State Guard. He and his motorcycle escort led the army units with nine hundred infantrymen, bands, and artillery attachments. Various other military organizations participated in the event. The parade marched in front of Gov. Prentice Cooper and what newspapers called the "biggest Nashville crowd in years." Planes from the Vultee plant and Civil Air Patrol flew over downtown Nashville.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Tennessee State Guard, 1941-1947
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Tennessee. Militia; Tennessee - History, Military; World War, 1939-1945
